title: Mountain Dwarf

***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

- *This page is a **[stub](/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. You could probably [expand this page](http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Mountain_Dwarf\&action=edit) should you wish to do so.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | Mountain Dwarves are stout and hardy folk, adept at fighting with axes and blugeoning weapons, though lacking the dexterity to excel at other forms of combat. Their reserves of magic are somewhat poor, though they still make passable spellcasters, and their connection with the blood of the earth gives them a particular talent at fire and earth magics. Their spell success is significantly less encumbered by armour than other species.They are superlative artisans and smiths, employed in ancient times by even the gods themselves, and this spiritual history makes them exceptional at invoking divine aid. They can even use enchantment scrolls to improve artefacts that would be beyond the understanding of any other species. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Starting Skills and Equipment](#Starting_Skills_and_Equipment)
- [5 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
  - [5.1 Compared to Minotaur](#Compared_to_Minotaur)
- [6 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [7 History](#History)

## Innate Abilities

- **Runic Magic**: The [encumbrance rating](/Encumbrance_rating "Encumbrance rating") of all armour you wear is reduced by 1/2 for purposes of [spell success](/Spell_success "Spell success").
- **Artefact Enchanting**: You can use [scrolls of enchant weapon](/Scrolls_of_enchant_weapon "Scrolls of enchant weapon") and [armour](/Scroll_of_enchant_armour "Scroll of enchant armour") upon random [artefacts](/Artefact "Artefact"). This includes artefacts cursed by [Ashenzari](/Ashenzari "Ashenzari"). Note that you cannot enchant [unrands](/Unrand "Unrand"), only [randarts](/Randart "Randart").

Mountain Dwarves have a base [Strength](/Strength "Strength") of 10, [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") of 8, and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") of 5 (before [background](/Background "Background") modifiers).

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Warriors**: [Fighter](/Fighter "Fighter"), [Monk](/Monk "Monk")
- **Zealots**: [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker"), [Cinder Acolyte](/Cinder_Acolyte "Cinder Acolyte")
- **Warrior-Mages**: [Reaver](/Reaver "Reaver")
- **Mages**: [Fire Elementalist](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist")

## Level Bonuses

- +1 [strength](/Strength "Strength") or [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") (equal chance) every 4th level.
- 10% more [HP](/HP "HP") than average.
- +4 [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") per level.

## Starting Skills and Equipment

Mountain Dwarves start with the skills and equipment listed for their background.

## Difficulty of Play

|                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Simple](/Category:Easy_species "Category:Easy species")** • [Intermediate](/Category:Moderate_species "Category:Moderate species") • [Advanced](/Category:Hard_species "Category:Hard species") |

Mountain Dwarves are an easy species to play, as they have high HP and good aptitudes for melee combat. They also have excellent skill in [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations"), making them better at using certain [gods](/Gods "Gods")' abilities. In addition, they can make passable and durable spellcasters.

### Compared to Minotaur

Melee Mountain Dwarves are similar to Minotaurs. Their differences are listed below:

- Minotaurs deal somewhat more damage in combat, due to having [Horns](/Horns "Horns"). This can make a difference, especially in the early Dungeon.
- Minotaurs have better defensive aptitudes ([Armour](/Armour "Armour"), [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"), [Shields](/Shields "Shields")), while Mountain Dwarves are better at Invocations.
- Minotaurs are better at most weapon skills, especially the [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity")-based ones ([Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades"), [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades"), [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")).
- Minotaurs are terrible at all magic schools. Mountain Dwarves not only have better magic aptitudes, but they also have an easier time casting in heavy armour.
- Mountain Dwarves can enchant [randarts](/Randart "Randart"), which makes it more viable to take a randart with a good base and properties even if the enchantment is low.

Overall, Minotaurs are better at pure melee, but both species are strong. Games are rarely lost because you picked one over the other. (It's worth noting that Trog, one of the most popular 'melee gods', doesn't rely on the Invocations skill at all.)

## History

- Mountain Dwarves returned in [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), replacing [Hill Orcs](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc").
- Mountain Dwarves were removed in version [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), which was met with protest from quite a few *Crawl* players. They were removed as MD, [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur"), and [Hill Orc](/Hill_Orc "Hill Orc") were all very similar melee/armour species. Most discussion happened in the #crawl-dev IRC channel; a lack of transparent communication meant that players who liked roleplaying as a Tolkien dwarf were upset at the sudden removal. Ultimately, the decision to axe MD and not Minotaur was [somewhat arbitrary](http://crawl.develz.org/wordpress/whisper-farewell-when-you-leave-gimli). For more context, see the aforementioned announcement and the [Tavern discussion](https://crawl.develz.org/tavern/viewtopic.php?f=8\&t=2938) about it.
- Prior to [0.8](/0.8 "0.8"), Mountain Dwarves received only +2 [MR](/MR "MR") per level.
- Prior to [0.6](/0.6 "0.6"), Mountain Dwarves received +4 [magic resistance](/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") points per level.

Mountain Dwarves are stout and hardy folk, adept at fighting with axes and blugeoning weapons, though lacking the dexterity to excel at other forms of combat. Their reserves of magic are somewhat poor, though they still make passable spellcasters, and their connection with the blood of the earth gives them a particular talent at fire and earth magics. Their spell success is significantly less encumbered by armour than other species.

They are superlative artisans and smiths, employed in ancient times by even the gods themselves, and this spiritual history makes them exceptional at invoking divine aid. They can even use enchantment scrolls to improve artefacts that would be beyond the understanding of any other species.

Innate Abilities

  • Runic Magic: The encumbrance rating of all armour you wear is reduced by 1/2 for purposes of spell success.
  • Artefact Enchanting: You can use scrolls of enchant weapon and armour upon random artefacts. This includes artefacts cursed by Ashenzari. Note that you cannot enchant unrands, only randarts.

Mountain Dwarves have a base Strength of 10, Intelligence of 8, and Dexterity of 5 (before background modifiers).

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Warriors: Fighter, Monk
  • Zealots: Berserker, Cinder Acolyte
  • Warrior-Mages: Reaver
  • Mages: Fire Elementalist

Level Bonuses

  • +1 strength or intelligence (equal chance) every 4th level.
  • 10% more HP than average.
  • +4 willpower per level.

Starting Skills and Equipment

Mountain Dwarves start with the skills and equipment listed for their background.

Difficulty of Play

Simple • Intermediate • Advanced

Mountain Dwarves are an easy species to play, as they have high HP and good aptitudes for melee combat. They also have excellent skill in Invocations, making them better at using certain gods' abilities. In addition, they can make passable and durable spellcasters.

Compared to Minotaur

Melee Mountain Dwarves are similar to Minotaurs. Their differences are listed below:

  • Minotaurs deal somewhat more damage in combat, due to having Horns. This can make a difference, especially in the early Dungeon.
  • Minotaurs have better defensive aptitudes (Armour, Dodging, Shields), while Mountain Dwarves are better at Invocations.
  • Minotaurs are better at most weapon skills, especially the Dexterity-based ones (Short Blades, Long Blades, Ranged Weapons).
  • Minotaurs are terrible at all magic schools. Mountain Dwarves not only have better magic aptitudes, but they also have an easier time casting in heavy armour.
  • Mountain Dwarves can enchant randarts, which makes it more viable to take a randart with a good base and properties even if the enchantment is low.

History

  • Mountain Dwarves returned in 0.32, replacing Hill Orcs.
  • Mountain Dwarves were removed in version 0.10, which was met with protest from quite a few Crawl players. They were removed as MD, Minotaur, and Hill Orc were all very similar melee/armour species. Most discussion happened in the #crawl-dev IRC channel; a lack of transparent communication meant that players who liked roleplaying as a Tolkien dwarf were upset at the sudden removal. Ultimately, the decision to axe MD and not Minotaur was somewhat arbitrary. For more context, see the aforementioned announcement and the Tavern discussion about it.
